answers.a: It acts as a sequestrant: the polyphosphate chain binds Ca2+ at multiple oxygen sites to form soluble complexes, preventing calcium from precipitating or causing scale/texture issues. Over time, hydrolysis to orthophosphate can convert some bound calcium into insoluble calcium phosphate, effectively removing it from solution.
